SENT.plain: Hyperostosis "thick legs" is reported in a case involving 7 of a litter of 11 purebred Landrace piglets
The 12 limbs involved showed variable degrees of thickening and immobility; tension and fixation of the skin
Necropsy revealed extensive fibrous connective tissue, enlargement and edema of associated lymph nodes and hypoplasia of muscle groups
Radiographs revealed osteodystrophia along the shafts of long bones
The case is compared to previous reports of infantile cortical hyperostosis in children and "thick legs" in pigs
